title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1824/85 of 1 July 1985 re-establishing the levying of customs duties on articles of apparel and clothing accessories falling within subheading 39.07 B V ex d) originating in Hong Kong to which the preferential tariff arrangements set out in Council Regulation (EEC) No 3562/84 apply
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 1824/85
of 1 July 1985
re-establishing the levying of customs duties on articles of apparel and clothing accessories falling within subheading 39.07 B V ex d) originating in Hong Kong to which the preferential tariff arrangements set out in Council Regulation (EEC) No 3562/84 apply
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN
COMMUNITIES
main_body:
As from 5 July 1985, the levying of customs duties, suspended pursuant to Council Regulation (EEC) No 3562/84, shall be on re-established imports into the Community of the following products originating in Hong Kong:
1.2 //   //   // CCT heading No  // Description  //   //  // 39.07 B V ex d) (NIMEXE code 39.07-45)  // Articles of apparel and clothing accessories  //   //

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 1 July 1985.
For the Commission
COCKFIELD
Vice-President
